lines.text: As God is my witness, I thought turkeys could fly.

[Fever runs into the booth and hides behind the coat rack]
What are you doin', man! I'm on the air!
Herb Tarlek is selling life insurance!
Oh, no! Close the blinds before he sees us!

[Walks into the booth]
What have I told you guys about goofing off when one of you is supposed to be on the air?
Herb Tarlek is selling life insurance!
Oh, no!
[slams the door and hides with Fever]
[Newscast from opening credits]
And the senator, while insisting he was not intoxicated, could not explain his nudity.
Do you have enough money to feed yourself?
Yes.
I don't, can you loan me some money?
No.
Can you loan me some food?
[Johnny is lying to keep from being beaten up by a big thug named Dave]
I'm Andy Travis, glad to meet you, (pointing to the real Andy Travis) that's my brother Randy and that's old Venus of course.
Of course.

[referring to Dave]
We don't know who the mountainoid is.
Name's Dave.
[after an elderly couple has broken into the DJ booth]
All right, you two, up against the wall! I don't what you want but you should know I've killed a lot of old people in my time. And I'm not above doing it again.
Mr. Craven I would like to ask you a question about the phone company.
Well that's what I'm here for, fire away.
You know the phone company won't give you a specific time when they'll come to install your phone. You have to wait all day long. Like most people, I work and can't take the whole day off.
Uh-Hunh.
So Saturday is the only day I'll be here. But because so many other people have the same problem, you can wait up to two, three weeks or more for service.
That's correct.
Could you tell me why that is?
Of course, it's like that because we don't have any competition.
Last night at that house, did anything happen?
I met a lady whose car I have to replace and I discovered we have a sex pervert in the neighborhood.
No, I mean did anything unusual happen?
[Venus is showing off his flashy wardrobe]
I only came downtown to have one of my suits serviced.
I'll bet a suit like that stays in the shop most of the time.
I got suits I can't get parts for.
It's bad luck to take advice from a crazy person.

[repeated sign-off line]
This is Les Nessman saying good day, and may the good news be yours.
[repeated line]
Oooo!
Have you noticed all the men in Landersville are going bald? I wonder if there's a nuclear power plant in the area.
It's a good thing I had an extra pair of jeans in my office.
[at a record store hosting a WKRP remote broadcast]
Del, goshdarnit I've got to go, but if you need anything, anything at all, I'll be in my car somewhere.

[saying that Bailey shouldn't produce the show]
This isn't the Ohio State School of Journalism, this is the big time.
[repeated line]
Okay fine.
